Documents/Programming/Projects/Bookmarksman/DeliciousTalker.h

00001 // A class supporting http connections with Delicious.
00002 // Logs in to Delicious if required, handles user interaction
00003 // Operation is synchronous; i.e. the entry method
00004 // deliciousTalkerWithURL:httpMethod:bodyString:etc. blocks
00005 // the invoking thread until the response is either finished
00006 // or is cancelled by the user.
00007 // DeliciousTalker is written as a state machine.
00008 
00009 @interface DeliciousTalker : NSObject {
00010         // state variables
00011         int _whatsNext ;  
00012         BOOL _newAccountWanted ;
00013         BOOL _usernameIsFromExtore ; // In this case, we don't allow changes
00014         
00015         // other variables
00016         NSDate* _timeToGiveUp ;
00017         float _nextTrialTimeout ;
00018         Extore* _extore ; // weak
00019         NSString* _url ;
00020         NSString* _bodyString; 
00021         NSString* _httpMethod ;
00022         int _responseType ;
00023         NSHTTPURLResponse* _response ;
00024         NSData* _responseData ;
00025         NSError* _error ;
00026         float _progress ;
00027         float _backoffDelay ;
00028 }
00029 
00030 
00031 + (BOOL)deliciousTalkerWithSubpathQuery:(NSString*)subpathQuery
00032                                          responseStatusCode:(int*)ptrResponseStatusCode
00033                                                 responseHeaders:(NSDictionary**)hdlResponseHeaders
00034                                                    responseData:(NSData**)hdlResponseData 
00035                                                                  extore:(Extore*)extore
00036                                                                 timeout:(float)timeout
00037                                                                   error:(NSError**)error ;
00038         // Returns YES if succeeded.
00039         // subpathQuery is the subpath and query following the scheme://host/path,
00040         //    which is "https://api.del.icio.us/v1/"
00041         // For example, to get all posts, subpathQuery is "posts/all?"
00042         // responseStatusCode, responseHeaders and responseData are provided on output
00043         // alert is an instance of SSYAlert, passed to notify user in case of trouble.
00044         // We don't like to pile alerts on top of alerts
00045 
00046         // If timeout is 0.0, will default to 60 seconds.  This is appropriate if
00047         // a cancel button is available to the user, but if not should be
00048         // set to maybe 10.0.
00049 
00050         // With the parameters as now set, passing a timeout less than 30 seconds
00051         // will result in a 10-second period timeout which will be tried three times.
00052 
00053         // See further discussion of this in .m
00054 
00055 @end
